tasks: Local Well-posedness for a System of Modified KdV Equations in Modulation Spaces
title: Local Well-Posedness for a System of Modified KdV Equations in Modulation Spaces.pdf
abstract: . In this work, we consider the initial value problem (IVP) for a system of modiﬁed Korteweg-de Vries (mKdV) equations    ∂tv + ∂3 xv + ∂x(vw2) = 0, v(x, 0) = ψ(x), ∂tw + α∂3 xw + ∂x(v2w) = 0, w(x, 0) = φ(x). The main interest is in addressing the well-posedness issues of the IVP when the initial data are considered in the modulation space M 2,p s (R), p ≥2. In the case when 0 < α ̸= 1, we derive new trilinear estimates in these spaces and prove that the IVP is locally well-posed for data in M 2,p s (R) whenever s > 1 4 −1 p and p ≥2. 1. Introduction In this work, we consider the initial value problem (IVP) for the following system of the modiﬁed Korteweg-de Vries (mKdV) type equations    ∂tv + ∂3 xv + ∂x(vw2) = 0, v(x, 0) = ψ(x), ∂tw + α∂3 xw + ∂x(v2w) = 0, w(x, 0) = φ(x), (1.1) with given data in modulation spaces (see (2.2) below), where x, t ∈R, 0 < α ̸= 1, v = v(x, t) and w = w(x, t) are real-valued functions. For α = 1 the system (1.1) reduces to a special case of broad class of nonlinear evolution cosidered by Ablowitz, Kaup, Newell and Segur [1] in the inverse scattering context. In this scenario, the issues of well-posedness, existence, and stability of solitary waves for this system have been exten- sively investigated in the literature. Applying the technique developed by Kenig, Ponce and Vega [24], we can prove that the IVP (1.1) is locally well-posed for given data in Hs(R) × Hs(R), for s ≥1 4 and α = 1. This approach utilizes the smoothing eﬀect of the linear group, combined with the Lp xLq t Strichartz estimates and maximal function estimates. Tao [32] demonstrated that this local result can also be established using the restricted norm method in the Fourier transform space Xs,b, as introduced by Bourgain [4]. In [26] Montenegro proved the local well-posedness for s ≥1 4 and, using the conservation laws of the 2020 Mathematics Subject Classiﬁcation. 35A01, 35Q53. Key words and phrases. Korteweg-de vries (KdV) equation, Initial value problems, Fourier-Lebesgue spaces, Mod- ulation spaces, Well-posedness. 1
